translated: Commentary on the Huayan School's Chapters and Records on Logic
Respectfully Recorded by Great Dharma Master EnchÅ of TÅdaiji Temple in Response to the Sacred King's Edict
Preface: I humbly believe that the rise of Buddhism has its reasons. In the realm of the Western Heaven,
ÅšÄkyamuni the Benevolent drove the deer park to unravel its source.
In the court of the Eastern Han Dynasty,
Emperor Xiaoming of the Han Dynasty dreamed of a golden man and sought its traces.
The extraordinary images of our country came to the shore.
The teachings of the subtle words were heard in the void.
In the thirteenth year of the reign of Emperor Kinra of the Ishinashima Kingdom, the Buddha Dharma was first transmitted.
After that, up to the fourteenth year of the Enryaku era,
it has been 353 years.
The Dharma treasures transmitted during this period are all included.
The teachings are divided and the streams are exhausted.
The copying of sÅ«tras and treatises competes in public and private.
The secret and manifest commentaries and sub-commentaries are only entrusted to people's minds.ğŸ”½Some are kept secret and not transmitted.
Some are scattered and not written.
The commentaries and sub-commentaries of various schools gradually become blocked.
The teachings of the White Horse cannot be explained without relying on this. I humbly think of the Chan-Ding Emperor.
In front of five hundred Buddhas.
Personally received the entrustment.
In the whole world, he temporarily manifests the body of a king.
He reveres the holy teachings and surpasses the five heavens.
He continues and promotes the exoteric and esoteric teachings, nearly doubling the teachings of China.
The Emperor ordered the copying and transmission of the chapters and commentaries.
He ordered the great scholars of the six schools to each submit their records.
Yuan Chao humbly accompanies the last students of the Huayan.
He is honored to present the records of his own school and the logic of inference.
He humbly relies on the correct reports of later sages.
